results.name: Pendular triangle, read by rows, where row n is formed from row n-1 by the recurrence: if n > 2k, T(n,k) = T(n,n-k) + T(n-1,k), else T(n,k) = T(n,n-1-k) + 2*T(n-1,k), for n>=k>=0, with T(n,0) = 1 and T(n,n) = 0^n.
comment: See A118340 for definition of pendular triangles and pendular sums.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of the triangle, flattened
formula: T(2*n+m,n) = [A118346^(m+1)](n), i.e., the m-th lower semi-diagonal forms the self-convolution (m+1)-power of A118346.
example: Row 6 equals the pendular sums of row 5:
[1,  4, 11,  6,  1,  0], where the pendular sums proceed as follows:
[1,  5, 18, 30,  7,  1, 0] finally, append a zero to obtain row 6.
